Key Match Events: Matt Wallner homered for the second straight game.
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double.
Royce Lewis nearly had his sixth career grand slam, but it was ruled a two-run double after review.
Taylor Ward led off the game with his 23rd homer for the Angels.
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid during a three-run fourth inning for the Twins.
Nolan Schanuel had his 13th homer of the season among three hits.
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer for the Angels.
Jhoan Duran secured his 23rd save despite surrendering three hits in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota manager Rocco Baldelli praised the team's offense and energy.
Matt Wallner expressed confidence in the team's hitting performance.
Jordyn Adams reflected on his approach at the plate leading to his first career homer.
Jack Kochanowicz acknowledged the need to improve his breaking balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Angels' INF Brandon Drury left the game with left hamstring tightness.
OF Bryce Teodosio sustained a small finger fracture but is expected to avoid the injured list.
Twins' OF Byron Buxton will be activated from the 10-day injured list prior to Friday's game against Cincinnati.
OF Manuel Margot was reinstated from the injured list after missing 10 games.
C Christian Vázquez was reinstated from the paternity list.
C Jaír Camargo and utility player Michael Helman were optioned to Triple-A.
